org.xlattice.util.threads

Class Worker

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.xlattice.util.threads.Worker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Killable

    public class Worker
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Killable
    A thread for use in a thread pool.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

      • die

        public final void die()
        Mark this thread as dying. Implementation: the thread may be either waiting in the while loop for a job or it may be actually running the job. In the first case, set dying, the variable tested in run()'s while loop, and then actually interrupt the thread. This will take an unpredictable amount of time to have an effect, but eventually the thread will exit the monitor, check the control variable, and do its termination routine. Jobs using this set of thread pool classes should be designed to accept this pattern. They should either respond in a sensible way to interrupts, or should periodically inspect a publicly accessible control variable, or do both.
        Specified by:
        die in interface Killable

      • run

        public final void run()
        If there is a job to run, run it.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

        protected void runNextJob()
